TableInput.Description: Johns Hopkins University Consolidated data on COVID-19 cases, sourced from Enigma
TableInput.Name: enigma_jhu

Columns.Comment: state and county two digits code
Columns.Name: fips

TableInput.Description: Johns Hopkins University data on COVID-19 cases, sourced from Enigma
TableInput.Name: enigma_jhu_timeseries

Columns.Comment: state and county two digits code
Columns.Name: fips

TableInput.Description: Johns Hopkins University data on COVID-19 cases, sourced from Tableau
TableInput.Name: tableau_jhu

Columns.Comment: difference in cases vs the previous day
Columns.Name: difference

Columns.Comment: state and county two digits code
Columns.Name: fips

Columns.Comment: timestamp when the data was generated for this data load
Columns.Name: prep_flow_runtime

TableInput.Description: Metadata on papers pulled from the Allen Institute.  The 'sha' column indicates the paper id
TableInput.Name: alleninstitute_metadata

Columns.Comment: unique identifier coming from CORD (COVID-19 Open Research Dataset)
Columns.Name: cord_uid

Columns.Comment: hash for the paper id.  can now include multiple files (some PMC files have multiple associated PDFs)
Columns.Name: sha

Columns.Comment: the data source, currently: PMC, biorxiv, CZI, or medrxiv
Columns.Name: source_x

Columns.Comment: When the paper was published.  Some papers are at the day level, while others are at the year.
Columns.Name: publish_time

Columns.Comment: journal in which the paper was published
Columns.Name: journal

Columns.Comment: paper id in microsoft academic (if applicable)
Columns.Name: microsoft academic paper id

Columns.Comment: whether the full text of the paper is available
Columns.Name: has_full_text

Columns.Comment: which S3 folder/prefix the full text is in
Columns.Name: full_text_file

Columns.Comment: url of the journal or paper
Columns.Name: url

TableInput.Description: Comprehend Medical results run against Allen Institute data on medical papers.
TableInput.Name: alleninstitute_comprehend_medical

Columns.Comment: All medical conditions listed. Includes present illness, reason for visit, and medical history
Columns.Name: dx_name

Columns.Comment: Procedures performed on a patient for diagnostic, measurement, screening, or rating that might have a resulting value
Columns.Name: test_name

Columns.Comment: Interventions as a one-time action performed on the patient to treat a medical condition or to provide patient care
Columns.Name: procedure_name

Columns.Comment: Any phone, fax, or pager number. Excludes named phone numbers, such as 1-800-QUIT-NOW and 911
Columns.Name: phone_or_fax

Columns.Comment: The date a test was performed
Columns.Name: time_to_test_name

Columns.Comment: Non-brand name, ingredient name, or formula mixture of the medication or therapeutic agent
Columns.Name: generic_name

Columns.Comment: All names. Typically, names of the patient, family, or provider
Columns.Name: name

Columns.Comment: The copyrighted brand name of the medication or therapeutic agent
Columns.Name: brand_name

Columns.Comment: All geographical subdivisions of an address of any facility, named medical facilities, or wards within a facility
Columns.Name: address

Columns.Comment: Social security number, medical record number, facility identification number, clinical trial number, certificate or license number, vehicle or device number. This includes any biometric number of the patient, place of care, or provider.
Columns.Name: id

Columns.Comment: Interventions performed over a span of time for combating a disease or disorder. This includes groupings of medications, such as antivirals and vaccinations
Columns.Name: treatment_name

Columns.Comment: Body systems, anatomic locations or regions, and body sites
Columns.Name: system_organ_site

Columns.Comment: The date a treatment was administered
Columns.Name: time_to_treatment_name

Columns.Comment: The date a medical condition occurred
Columns.Name: time_to_dx_name

Columns.Comment: The date a medication was taken
Columns.Name: time_to_medication_name

Columns.Comment: The date a procedure was performed
Columns.Name: time_to_procedure_name

Columns.Comment: Any profession or employer that pertains to the patient or the patient's family. It does include the profession of the clinician mentioned in the note
Columns.Name: profession

Columns.Comment: All components of age, spans of age, or any age mentioned. This includes those of a patient, family members, or others. The default is in years unless otherwise noted
Columns.Name: age

TableInput.Description: USA total test daily trend.  Sourced from covidtracking.com via REARC
TableInput.Name: covid_testing_us_daily

Columns.Comment: number of states and territories included
Columns.Name: states

Columns.Comment: increase in deaths vs previous day
Columns.Name: deathIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in hospitalized patients vs previous day
Columns.Name: hospitalizedIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in negative cases vs previous day
Columns.Name: negativeIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in positive cases vs previous day
Columns.Name: positiveIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in total results vs previous day
Columns.Name: totalTestResultsIncrease

TableInput.Description: USA total test daily trend by state.  Sourced from covidtracking.com via REARC
TableInput.Name: covid_testing_states_daily

Columns.Comment: increase in deaths vs previous day
Columns.Name: deathIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in hospitalized patients vs previous day
Columns.Name: hospitalizedIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in negative cases vs previous day
Columns.Name: negativeIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in positive cases vs previous day
Columns.Name: positiveIncrease

Columns.Comment: increase in total results vs previous day
Columns.Name: totalTestResultsIncrease

TableInput.Description: USA total tests.  Sourced from covidtracking.com via REARC
TableInput.Name: covid_testing_us_total

TableInput.Description: Lookup table for US state abbreviations
TableInput.Name: us_state_abbreviations

TableInput.Description: Lookup table for population for each county based on recent census data
TableInput.Name: county_populations

TableInput.Description: Lookup table for country codes
TableInput.Name: country_codes

TableInput.Description: Data on COVID-19 cases from NY Times at US county level
TableInput.Name: nytimes_counties

TableInput.Description: Data on COVID-19 cases from NY Times at US state level
TableInput.Name: nytimes_states

TableInput.Description: Data on hospital beds and their utilization in the US.  Sourced from Definitive Healthcare via rearc
TableInput.Name: hospital_beds

Columns.Comment: Short Term Acute Care Hospital (STAC), Critical Access Hospital (CAH), Long Term Acute Care Hospitals, Children’s Hospitals, Veteran's Affairs (VA) Hospital or Department of Defense (DoD) Hospital
Columns.Name: hospital_type

Columns.Comment: maximum number of beds for which a hospital holds a license to operate
Columns.Name: num_licensed_beds

Columns.Comment: adult bed, pediatric bed, birthing room, or newborn ICU bed (excluding newborn bassinets) maintained in a patient care area for lodging patients in acute, long term, or domiciliary areas of the hospital.
Columns.Name: num_staffed_beds

Columns.Comment: ICU beds, burn ICU beds, surgical ICU beds, premature ICU beds, neonatal ICU beds, pediatric ICU beds, psychiatric ICU beds, trauma ICU beds, and Detox ICU beds
Columns.Name: num_icu_beds

Columns.Comment: calculated based on metrics from the Medicare Cost Report: Bed Utilization Rate = Total Patient Days (excluding nursery days)/Bed Days Available
Columns.Name: bed_utilization

Columns.Comment: computed by subtracting “Number of Staffed Beds from Number of Licensed beds” (Licensed Beds – Staffed Beds). This would provide insights into scenario planning for when staff can be shifted around to increase available bed capacity as needed.
Columns.Name: potential_increase_in_bed_capac

TableInput.Description: CMU Delphi's COVID-19 Surveillance Data
TableInput.Name: covidcast_data

Columns.Comment: name of upstream data source (e.g., fb-survey, google-survey, ght, quidel, doctor-visits)
Columns.Name: data_source

Columns.Comment: name of signal derived from upstream data
Columns.Name: signal

Columns.Comment: spatial resolution of the signal (e.g., county, hrr, msa, dma, state)
Columns.Name: geo_type

Columns.Comment: time unit (e.g., date) over which underlying events happened
Columns.Name: time_value

Columns.Comment: unique code for each location, depending on geo_type (county -> FIPS 6-4 code, HRR -> HRR number, MSA -> CBSA code, DMA -> DMA code, state -> two-letter state code), or * for all
Columns.Name: geo_value

Columns.Comment: trend classifier (+1 -> increasing, 0 steady or not determined, -1 -> decreasing)
Columns.Name: direction

Columns.Comment: value (statistic) derived from the underlying data source
Columns.Name: value

Columns.Comment: standard error of the statistic with respect to its sampling distribution
Columns.Name: stderr

Columns.Comment: number of data points used in computing the statistic
Columns.Name: sample_size

TableInput.Description: CMU Delphi's COVID-19 Surveillance Metadata
TableInput.Name: covidcast_metadata

Columns.Comment: name of upstream data source (e.g., fb-survey, google-survey, ght, quidel, doctor-visits)
Columns.Name: data_source

Columns.Comment: name of signal derived from upstream data
Columns.Name: signal

Columns.Comment: temporal resolution of the signal (e.g., day, week)
Columns.Name: time_type

Columns.Comment: geographic resolution (e.g. county, hrr, msa, dma, state)
Columns.Name: geo_type

TableInput.Description: COVID-19 data that has been gathered and unified from trusted sources to include the New York Times and the European CDC. Sourced from Tableau

Columns.Name: data_source_name

Columns.Name: people_positive_new_cases_count

TableInput.Name: world_cases_deaths_testing

TableInput.Description: Contact Tracing data from AspireVC
TableInput.Name: aspirevc_crowd_tracing

Columns.Comment: Unique Tokenized identifier of kiosk device
Columns.Name: scannerdeviceid

Columns.Comment: Total number of people they can hold
Columns.Name: location_maxcapacity

Columns.Comment: Unique Tokenized identifier of smart phone
Columns.Name: userdeviceid

Columns.Comment: Time in seconds for how long it took the user to complete the survey
Columns.Name: duration

Columns.Comment: Classification determined by the Go Pass system
Columns.Name: risklevel

Columns.Comment: The type of door being entered. 'Public' or 'Private'
Columns.Name: accesslevel

Columns.Comment: Device type used.  'Gate' or 'Personal' (Gate = Kiosk; Personal = Smart Phone)
Columns.Name: readtype

Columns.Comment: Past 2 weeks, have you had any of the following symptoms: shortness of breath, fever, loss of taste or smell, new cough?
Columns.Name: symptoms

Columns.Comment: Past 2 weeks, have you been diagnosed with COVID or are waiting for COVID test results?
Columns.Name: diagnosed

Columns.Comment: Past 2 weeks, have you been in contact with anyone who has been diagnosed with COVID or is waiting for COVID test results?
Columns.Name: contact

Columns.Comment: Past 2 weeks, have you been near anyone with the following symptoms: shortness of breath, fever, loss of taste or smell, new cough?
Columns.Name: near
